Sammy Interface¶

This module houses a number of functions used to interface with the SAMMY code from ORNL, primarily reading and writing input/output files.

Created on Wed Jun 22 12:30:52 2022

@author: noahwalton

syndat.sammy_interface.write_samdat(transmission_data, filename)[source]¶

Writes a formatted sammy.dat file.

These DataFrame keys required correspond to the “trans” DataFrame generated by Syndat. This is an attribute of the experiment object once the experiment is “run”. The uncertainty on the experimental data point must be absolute for this formatting as it corresponds to the sammy format with “use twenty significant digits” or “twenty” in the input file. If this flag is not in the sammy input file, the uncertainty should not be absolute and the formatting (space between variables) changes.

Parameters

  • transmission_data (DataFrame) – DataFrame containing experimental transmission data, requires columns [“E”, “exp_trans”, and “exp_trans_unc”].

  • filename (str) – Filepath/name for the sammy.dat file being created.

Raises

  • ValueError – Energy column not in DataFrame.

  • ValueError – Experimental transmission column not in DataFrame.

  • ValueError – Experimental transmission uncertainty column not in DataFrame.
